title: Hollyoaks spoilers: Shock dementia diagnosis for serial killer Breda?
text:
(Picture: Lime Pictures)

With Tony Hutchison (Nick Pickard) her prisoner up at the pig farm, Breda McQueen (Moya Brady) has been behaving rather odd in Hollyoaks lately, and this behaviour hasn’t gone unnoticed by her children Goldie (Chelsee Healey) and Sylver (David Tag). In the coming episodes, they beg Breda to see a psychiatrist and, she agrees to do so simply to placate them. However, things don’t exactly go according to plan.

Breda has been disposing of those whom she deems to be bad dads for the best part of a year, but her plan has started to unravel as of late, as she never planned for Tony to get caught up in her mission. Trying to do what she believes is right, she’s allowed Tony to live, but in doing so she’s created a whole lot of problems for herself, as she’s desperately tried to keep his presence up at the pig farm a secret.

It didn’t take Goldie too long to notice her mum’s odd behaviour, and both Sylver and Jack (Jimmy McKenna) copped on to the fact that something’s not quite right too, and thus they set a plan in motion in the coming episodes, as Goldie books her an appointment with a psychiatrist — much to Breda’s dismay.

Yes, Breda isn’t pleased about what Goldie’s done, and thus she rants to Tony about it. However, she later realises that going to the appointment could well prove to be the answer she needs, as it would get her children of her back.

However, things don’t go according to plan, and Breda gets frustrated during the appointment, as she feels like she’s being interrogated. She gets incredibly defensive, but the psychiatrist misinterprets Breda’s actions and words, and believes that she’s demonstrating confusion.

Later, the psychiatrist informs a worried Goldie, Sylver and Jack that she thinks Breda may have dementia.

Will they work out what’s really going on?

Hollyoaks continues Friday 18th October at 7pm on E4.
